titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vita Sackville-West Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:20

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists chiefly of correspondence, diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, business and estate records, writings, lectures, and gardening papers. Correspondents include family members such as Lionel Edward Sackville-West, Victoria Sackville, Harold Nicolson, and Nigel Nicolson, and friends and lovers including Rosamund Grosvenor, Hilda Matheson, Gwen St. Aubyn, and Christopher St. John. Writings include typescripts and manuscripts for works including the novels The Edwardians and All Passion Spent . Gardening papers include horticultural catalogs, files on the National Trust's garden committee, and research materials. The collection documents Vita Sackville-West's family life, love affairs with women including Christopher St. John and Gwen St. Aubyn, her literary life and circle, including both Sackville-West's work and that of friends including Virginia Woolf, and the management of the Sissinghurst Castle estate and gardens.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English; some materials in French and Italian.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bernard Quaritch, Ltd. on the Chauncey Brewster Tinker Prize Fund, the Frederick W. Hilles Fund, and the Hubert Amer McGuire Memorial Fund, 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Vita Sackville-West Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vita Sackville-West Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Vita Sackville-West
bioghist.p: Vita (Victoria) Sackville-West (1892-1962), was an English author, poet and gardener. She was the daughter of Lionel Sackville-West, 3rd Baron Sackville, and Victoria Sackville-West. She and her husband Sir Harold Nicolson created the gardens at their Sissinghurst Castle estate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists chiefly of correspondence, diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, business and estate records, writings, lectures, and gardening papers. Correspondents include family members such as Lionel Edward Sackville-West, Victoria Sackville, Harold Nicolson, and Nigel Nicolson, and friends and lovers including Rosamund Grosvenor, Hilda Matheson, Gwen St. Aubyn, and Christopher St. John. Writings include typescripts and manuscripts for works including the novels The Edwardians and All Passion Spent . Gardening papers include horticultural catalogs, files on the National Trust's garden committee, and research materials. The collection documents Vita Sackville-West's family life, love affairs with women including Christopher St. John and Gwen St. Aubyn, her literary life and circle, including both Sackville-West's work and that of friends including Virginia Woolf, and the management of the Sissinghurst Castle estate and gardens.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1897-2003. II. Personal Papers, 1900s-1960s. III. Writings and Lectures, 1920s-1990s. IV. Gardening Papers, 1930s-1960s.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Harold Nicolson Papers (GEN MSS 614). Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

did.unittitle: Correspondence to and from Vita Sackville-West

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming correspondence from Rosamund Grosvenor, Vita's mother Lady Sackville, Miss Macmillan, Hilda Matheson, and others. Outgoing correspondence includes letters from Vita to Lady Sackville and others, as well as copies of letters to Rosamund Grosvenor. Also includes correspondence documenting the sale of furniture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence from Pat Dansey, Sybil Colefax, Cyril Connolly, Ruth Draper, Rosamund Grosvenor, Eardley Knollys, Lord Lascelles, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence from Harold Nicolson, Benedict Nicolson, Nigel Nicolson, Lady Powerscourt, Lady Sackville, Lord (Lionel) Sackville, Gwen St. Aubyn, Christopher St. John, and others, including letters to Vita Sackville-West regarding her mother Lady Sackville. Also includes letters to Lady Sackville from Geoffrey Scott and Lord Sackville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence to Vita Sackville-West from Margaret Voigt, Mrs. Wilton, Laura James, the staff of the Queen Mother, and others, as well as assorted family correspondence, including condolence letters following the death of Lord Sackville. Also includes photographs of Hilda Matheson, excerpts from correspondence with Margaret Howard, and Nigel Nicolson correspondence and other papers related to his biographical writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes travel diaries, daybooks, and gardening notebooks. Also contains news clippings and Christopher St. John's "horrifying document," a manuscript notebook detailing the end of her affair with Sackville-West in 1933.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes travel diaries, daybooks, and gardening notebooks. Also contains at least one datebook kept by Lady Sackville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Financial statements and correspondence documenting the managment of the Sissinghurst Castle estate, personal property, and Lady Sackville's death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes news clippings covering Vita Sackville-West's publications and one scrapbook with clippings about Virginia Woolf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes news clippings relating to Heritage , The Dragon in Shallow Waters , Orchard and Vinyard , Grand Canyon , The Eagle and the Dove , and other publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings from The Edwardians , All Passions Spent , The Dark Island , and other publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings from "Country Notes" for the New Statesman .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Documentation of honors and distinctions awarded Vita Sackville-West, with correspondence. Also includes records of a loan to her son Nigel Nicolson's publishing company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material from The Edwardians , Faces: Profiles of Dogs , The Eagle and the Dove , All Passion Spent , The Easter Party , and other publications; notes from national broadcast talks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material from Family History , The Grand Canyon , Passenger to Tehran , Nursery Rhymes and other publications; also includes material from "The Metaphysical School", "Is it Still a Disadvantage to be a Woman" lectures and other talks and lectures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mostly material from lectures, talks and presentations given in person and on radio throughout the UK and Europe.

did.unittitle: Business correspondence relating to publishing and royalties
Writings by others about Vita Sackville-West

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Horticultural catalogs, files on The National Trust's garden committee, gardening research and material on ornamental fauna.
